intro: Galium bryophilum, commonly known as the mossy bedstraw, is a flowering plant species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and usually covered in fine hairs, while its stems are prostrate or ascending. Galium bryophilum plays a role in supporting local insect populations and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
